lines.text: Enter GONERIL and EDMUND

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Welcome, my lord: I marvel our mild husband Not met us on the way. Now, where's your master'?
Enter OSWALD

lines.speaker: oswald
lines.text: Madam, within; but never man so changed. I told him of the army that was landed; He smiled at it: I told him you were coming: His answer was 'The worse:' of Gloucester's treachery, And of the loyal service of his son, When I inform'd him, then he call'd me sot, And told me I had turn'd the wrong side out: What most he should dislike seems pleasant to him; What like, offensive.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: [To EDMUND]  Then shall you go no further. It is the cowish terror of his spirit, That dares not undertake: he'll not feel wrongs Which tie him to an answer. Our wishes on the way May prove effects. Back, Edmund, to my brother; Hasten his musters and conduct his powers: I must change arms at home, and give the distaff Into my husband's hands. This trusty servant Shall pass between us: ere long you are like to hear, If you dare venture in your own behalf, A mistress's command. Wear this; spare speech; Decline your head: this kiss, if it durst speak, Would stretch thy spirits up into the air: Conceive, and fare thee well.
Giving a favour

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Yours in the ranks of death.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: My most dear Gloucester! O, the difference of man and man! To thee a woman's services are due: My fool usurps my body.
Exit EDMUND

lines.speaker: oswald
lines.text: Madam, here comes my lord.
Exit
Enter ALBANY

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: I have been worth the whistle.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: O Goneril! You are not worth the dust which the rude wind Blows in your face. I fear your disposition: That nature, which contemns its origin, Cannot be border'd certain in itself; She that herself will sliver and disbranch From her material sap, perforce must wither And come to deadly use.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: No more; the text is foolish.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Wisdom and goodness to the vile seem vile: Filths savour but themselves. What have you done? Tigers, not daughters, what have you perform'd? A father, and a gracious aged man, Whose reverence even the head-lugg'd bear would lick, Most barbarous, most degenerate! have you madded. Could my good brother suffer you to do it? A man, a prince, by him so benefited! If that the heavens do not their visible spirits Send quickly down to tame these vile offences, It will come, Humanity must perforce prey on itself, Like monsters of the deep.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Milk-liver'd man! That bear'st a cheek for blows, a head for wrongs; Who hast not in thy brows an eye discerning Thine honour from thy suffering; that not know'st Fools do those villains pity who are punish'd Ere they have done their mischief. Where's thy drum? France spreads his banners in our noiseless land; With plumed helm thy slayer begins threats; Whiles thou, a moral fool, sit'st still, and criest 'Alack, why does he so?'

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: See thyself, devil! Proper deformity seems not in the fiend So horrid as in woman.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: O vain fool!

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Thou changed and self-cover'd thing, for shame, Be-monster not thy feature. Were't my fitness To let these hands obey my blood, They are apt enough to dislocate and tear Thy flesh and bones: howe'er thou art a fiend, A woman's shape doth shield thee.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Marry, your manhood now--
Enter a Messenger

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: What news?

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: O, my good lord, the Duke of Cornwall's dead: Slain by his servant, going to put out The other eye of Gloucester.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Gloucester's eye!

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: A servant that he bred, thrill'd with remorse, Opposed against the act, bending his sword To his great master; who, thereat enraged, Flew on him, and amongst them fell'd him dead; But not without that harmful stroke, which since Hath pluck'd him after.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: This shows you are above, You justicers, that these our nether crimes So speedily can venge! But, O poor Gloucester! Lost he his other eye?

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Both, both, my lord. This letter, madam, craves a speedy answer; 'Tis from your sister.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: [Aside]              One way I like this well; But being widow, and my Gloucester with her, May all the building in my fancy pluck Upon my hateful life: another way, The news is not so tart.--I'll read, and answer.
Exit

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Where was his son when they did take his eyes?

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Come with my lady hither.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: He is not here.

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: No, my good lord; I met him back again.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Knows he the wickedness?

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Ay, my good lord; 'twas he inform'd against him; And quit the house on purpose, that their punishment Might have the freer course.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Gloucester, I live To thank thee for the love thou show'dst the king, And to revenge thine eyes. Come hither, friend: Tell me what more thou know'st.
Exeunt
